intro: Macrolobium machaerioides, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, pendulous clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in tropical regions.
